alert.note: Alert for Boone; Carroll; Gallatin; Grant; Kenton; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 9:35AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN, RIPLEY, DEARBORN, SWITZERLAND, CARROLL, SOUTHERN KENTON, BOONE, NORTHWESTERN GRANT, NORTHWESTERN OWEN AND GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 AM EDT... At 935 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Lake Santee to 7 miles northwest of Brownstown, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Florence, Independence, Erlanger, Elsmere, Batesville, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Carrollton, Aurora, Walton, Rising Sun, Burlington, Oakbrook, Union, Crittenden, Versailles, Milan, Vevay, Osgood and Warsaw. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 39 and 77. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 154. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 165 and 182. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
